summary: This is an email exchange between an FBI agent and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding sending a letter to Jeffrey Epstein's people and checking if a judge changed the language of a judgment. It shows coordination between law enforcement and prosecutors in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Requests a file to verify if a judge changed the language of a judgment regarding Epstein's case.

events.title: Email exchange about Epstein case
events.description: Email exchange between FBI agent and Assistant U.S. Attorney discussing sending a letter to Epstein's people and checking if a judge changed judgment language.

keyFacts: Email exchange shows coordination between FBI and U.S. Attorney's office regarding Epstein case in November 2008.
Discussion about sending a letter to Epstein's people and verifying if a judge changed judgment language.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney is based in West Palm Beach, Florida.
The email suggests ongoing legal proceedings or negotiations involving Epstein at this time.
